Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Chris H
Reviews.Content: Disgusting. All the communal bathrooms have a vile smell of sewerage. When I complained of this to the landlord I was told that this is a problem with the London sewerage system. The room was gloomy and mouldy. The noise from the traffic all night was serious. DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for one night if you dont want to park!”
Reviews.Author: KimQueenofQuo
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on various websites we tried to cancel this room but because it was last minute we couldn’t! We arrived by car so had to park in Sainsbury’s across the road which has 2 hour free parking for customers. We entered the pub which was full of people watching the football. The guy behind the bar went to find the manager who then had to go and find the key for our room? I asked 2 to 3 times about the parking? After a bit of whispering with their backs turned on us the ‘manager’ said just park up the street at the side of the pub? The room looked recently decorated and new carpet had been put down. The bed – metal creaky metal IKEA type looked new and the bedding was ok. The curtains were so thin the road lights etc shone through all night. There was a sink in the room which had a sign says ‘please do not use’ and we had to share a toilet down the corridor which both were clean and plenty of loo roll, soap etc. Bathroom? No idea we were up and gone by 6am because of the parking. The pub doesn’t open until 12 noon so you have to leave the key in your room which means you can’t lock it? Not sure how you get on if something goes missing? There were still areas in the corridor where the ceiling was covered in damp/wet/mould? Breakfast – In room - 2 small boxes of cornflakes UHT skimmed milk and an orange juice in the fridge. There is a small worktop size fridge in the room with a small TV balanced on it! Didn’t try it to see if it worked though? There was a couple of towels supplied and kettle with tea, coffee and sugar. When the pub is closed ie before 12 noon and after 11pm you have to enter the hotel via the back up 4 flights of fire exit which in the dark and rain can be a challenge and if you don’t like climbing steps where you can see between them or you don’t like heights this isn’t for you! If you want to park don’t bother booking this ‘hotel’ If you want a good night’s sleep don’t book this ‘hotel’ If you’re not bothered and its only for a few hours you should survive!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: napmum
Reviews.Content: Squeaky bed, mould in shower room, breakfast box of cereal in your room with UHT milk & carton of Capri-sun! Not clear where reception is, its the bar in the pub. There is work in progress so it may be improving & the staff were lovely.

Reviews.Title: “If you get what you pay for, this place should be much cheaper.”
Reviews.Author: mundaetraversa
Reviews.Content: I used to live in the UK, but my wife had never been before, so we traveled there to see friends and have her check out the traditional first-time-to-England stuff like Big Ben, etc. I really wanted her to like it so that we could come back again and again, as it's one of my favorite places in the world. We are backpackers, and travel cheaply - we do not have high expectations at all. I have to say that I was appalled at this accomodation. It's possible that our room was unfortunately one of the worst, but the bed squeaked horribly and was very old. It did not help us to feel rested for the long days of walking around the city. The television was ancient, tiny, and non-functional anyway. The carpet was filthy, the in-room sink nasty, and the dishes for tea and cereal were so gross that we didn't feel it would be sanitary to eat from them. So much for saving money each morning on food. The bathroom on our floor does not appear in any pictures anywhere online, which makes me wish I had taken some so I could post them. I have stayed in lots of hostels in lots of countries, and I have to say that was the. Most. Disgusting. Bathroom. Ever. I have had cleaner toilets on the desert road between Alexandria and Cairo. Seriously. We didn't mind the fire escape entrance or the pub downstairs (we quite liked the pub, actually. Watched a bunch of football and got drunk enough to forget where we'd have to pee and sleep later), and the junction location was okay for us - we enjoyed the walk to the tube each morning, and having the shopping center across the street from the pub was helpful. We like the hostel experience and being outside of the city center, and I can understand the older amenities and mismatched furniture - no problem. But I cannot accept the lack of basic sanitation, the moldy sink, unclean dishes, and a shower that is truly one of the worst travel experiences of my life. Choose another hostel and keep from getting sick - or just really grossed out.

Reviews.Title: “A Beacon of Hope”
Reviews.Author: Bushbaybee
Reviews.Content: After checking into and straight back out of a terrible hotel in Finsbury Park we were stuck in London without a room - we wanted to stay in this area as it was within walking distance of the Emirates stadium for the Arsenal match. We had a look at 4 or 5 hotels in Finsbury Park and they were all terrible! Finaly found the Beaconsfield and it was just what we were after - budget rooms which were clean and had an ensuite. The gent at the bar was helpful and friendly and the only problem we had was parking - it is free after 6pm until 8 in the morning - outside these times u need to buy a pass which is 7.50 for 2 hours!! Bed was comfortable and the cereal milk tea coffee and juice was a nice touch. Quiet room as well and there is a shopping centre and 24hr McDonalds over the road as well.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: Rachel187791
Reviews.Content: My plane was due to arrive in London after the 11:00PM check in closing time. When I called to ask if that constituted a problem, the staff tricked me into booking assuring they would have left the keys at the 24hour shop next door. After booking - and paying - I called again FOUR DAYS LATER to confirm about the keys. I was told that was no longer an option, that there was no way to check in after 11:00PM, and that if I still intended to sleep at the Beaconsfield that night, my only option would be "changing the flight".

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: EnglandHolidayguy
Reviews.Content: As with any hotel you pay a cheap price you shouldn't expect 5* We had a 'Luxury' room which is a room with your own en suite. Everything was clean and tidy, bed was comfortable and toliet/shower facilities were excellent! Breakfast was a bit random, just ceral and milk in your room fridge, but at least you get breakfast (nowhere does it state full English) I liked it for a nights stay and the pub is really good downstairs. Late night access is easy just at the side of the hotel and up the metal (fire escape) stairs to the first floor then open the door with the key provided :)

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special but reasonable”
Reviews.Author: nathndcharl
Reviews.Content: My fiancee farther and grandad and I stayed at this hotel as we were going to watch the PDC Darts Champonship. The room we had was a triple room up on the top floor which has been referbished, the room was modern and beds were comfortable. The bathroom was also modern and very clean, we had hot water every day and there was three of us showering everyday, the shower was very powerfull. Yes the rooms are situated on top of a pub but you dont hear nothing what so ever as the pub is not a lively pub and doesnt stay open untill all hours. Couldnt ask for more for the price we payed Â£140 for a triple room for 2 nights, what more can you ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Really overpriced and no hot water”
Reviews.Author: connie25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Beaconsfiel for a family get to-gether in London. On arrival we had to go up a fire escape, having got over the shock of that decided to have a shower before we went out,, there was no hot water, plus there was not hot water for the two days we were there, we tried the tell a manageress and she just fobbed us off to the Barman to deal with us. They also overcharged us for the room and did not offer us a refund, this place is not worth half the price we paid for the room, having paid 75 pounds per night and not breakfeast, only two boxes of cornflakes, and a carton of long life milk, room had no blinds in the windows, and you wake in the morning with the light . It is a total rip-off and would never stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor, booked in for 2 nights, left after 1.”
Reviews.Author: CORIreland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a complete rip off. The TV doesn't work and the free Wi-FI doesn't work. The continental breaskfast is 2 small boxes of cereal on a fridge in the room and 2 capri-suns in the fridge. The windows are single glazed and there is alot of noise from cars on street outside as the building is located on a junction. Beds have no support and springs going up through your ribs so I had to use a towel on top of sheet. Don't stay here - I know its cheap but its also very very nasty. Carol.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but shabby”
Reviews.Author: AbbsG
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights. Location was okay, 2 kms walk from the tube, on the piccadilly line which was good. Room was sizey enough but very plain with no curtain so we awoke early each morning. It was a little cold when we were there and the room wasn't well heated. Bathrooms needed a makeover and a good cleaning. Breakfast very simple, cereal and orange juice. Microwave in room was useful. Pub downstairs was pretty good, got a little loud on weekends when trying to sleep. Didn't serve meals though. I didn't feel at all unsafe here. Was next door to a park which was nice for a quick jog. For the price it was okay, I'd consider going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Beaconsfield Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hajohns1982
Reviews.Content: Not bad... Small rooms. Nice staff though. Pub on ground floor. Shopping center right across the street. Underground station was a 5 minute walk....Was expecting worse from reviews...Shared bathrooms with everyone on that same floor. Bathroons were not the best...If you plan to spend alot of time in your room, proabably not a good choice. If you are only planning to shower and sleep and don't want to spend a lot of $$ then this is a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “dirty not a hotel is a pub”
Reviews.Author: marks00000
Reviews.Content: not a hotel but a pub, small rooms very noisy on top of pub rough area very dangerous enviroment

HotelInfo.Name: Beaconsfield
HotelInfo.Address: 357-359 Green Lanes | Mitchell, London N4 1DZ, England
